title: Is Batman more like the Joker or more like Robin?
description:
Spend enough time in academia and you might start to think that this is an excellent research question. In this post
I try to give an answer by calculating the website similarities between the Wikipedia pages of Batman, the Joker and
Robin. Some web scraping, data wrangling and NLP with Python lies ahead!

title: Concentration properties of high-dimensional normal distributions
description:
Our intuition and experience in low dimensions tells us that random standard normal vectors cluster around the origin.
In higher dimensions, this is no longer true. Instead, despite having expectation zero, n-dimensional vectors with 
independent N(0,1) entries will concentrate tightly around a sphere of radius n^0.5. 
In particular, they will be nowhere near the origin. In this post we look at the mathematical theory behind why
that is.

title: Web crawling with R part 2: Power laws and enlightened squirrels
description: In this post we analyze the data we scraped in part one of the web crawling with R series. We find that the degree distribution of the hyperlink 2-neighborhood of the English Wikipedia page for "Squirrel" follows a power-law distribution and stumble across some unexpected topics in our network.

title: Web crawling with R part 1: Teaching rvest how to crawl
description:
rvest is a great package for downloading information from the internet straight into your R session. 
However, it does not natively "crawl" the web, i.e. traverse from one website to another. So let's teach it!

title: The list of things we all know we should know
description:
Welcome to my new blog, SteinsZeit. I hope you enjoy 
reading what I have to say! For my first blog post I have compiled a list of useful maths and programming 
references and guides.
